p: RNA sequencing was performed in four Notch4 d1 mice (2 females and 2 males) and six Notch3 d1 mice (3 females and 3 males) in an illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing machine (Illumina, San Diego, CA) at a strand specific 100 cycle paired-end resolution as described recentlyÂ [3]. Sequencing generated between 28.0 to 32.1 million reads per sample. The read quality was assessed using the fastQC software [13]. The quality score per sequence measured in the Phred quality scale was on average above 32 for all the samples. Sequenced reads were mapped to the mouse genome (GRCm38.rel97) using STAR software, version 2.6.1c [14]. Between 91% and 96% of the sequenced reads mapped to the reference genome, resulting in 26.5 and 29.3 million mapped reads per sample.
